edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikProduct
Class SigmaDJProductProverInput

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikProduct.SigmaDJProductProverInput
All Implemented Interfaces:
SigmaProverInput, ZKProverInput
public class SigmaDJProductProverInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProverInput

Concrete implementation of SigmaProtocol input, used by the SigmaDamgardJurikProductProver.

In SigmaProtocolDamgardJurikProduct, the prover gets DamgardJurikPublicKey, three BigIntegerCiphertexts and three random BigIntegers used to encrypt.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Sets the given public key, three ciphertexts, three random values, and two plaintexts.

Parameters:
publicKey - used to encrypt.
c1 - first ciphertext
c2 - second ciphertext
c3 - third ciphertext
r1 - first random number used to encrypt x1
r2 - first random number used to encrypt x2
r3 - first random number used to encrypt x3
x1 - first plaintext
x2 - second plaintext

SigmaDJProductProverInput

public SigmaDJProductProverInput(DamgardJurikPublicKey publicKey,
                                 BigIntegerCiphertext c1,
                                 BigIntegerCiphertext c2,
                                 BigIntegerCiphertext c3,
                                 DamgardJurikPrivateKey privateKey,
                                 BigIntegerPlainText x1,
                                 BigIntegerPlainText x2)
This protocol assumes that the prover knows the randomness used to encrypt. If the prover knows the secret key, then it can compute (once) the value m=n^(-1) mod phi(n)=n^(-1) mod (p-1)(q-1). Then, it can recover the randomness ri from ci by computing ci^m mod n (this equals ri^(n/n) mod n = ri). Once given r, the prover can proceed with the protocol.

Parameters:
c1 - first ciphertext
c2 - second ciphertext
c3 - third ciphertext
privateKey - used to recover r1, r2, r3
x1 - first plaintext
x2 - second plaintext
